comment.author: 43854658@N00
comment._content: "Cyrus Townsend Brady (December 20, 1861 – January 24, 1920) was a journalist, historian and adventure writer. His most well-known work is "Indian Fights and Fighters". He was born in Allegheny, Pennsylvania, and graduated from the U.S. Naval Academy in 1883. He was also a deacon in the Episcopal church. His first wife was Clarissa Guthrie, who died in 1890. His second wife was Mary Barrett. "Brady died in Yonkers, New York of pneumonia at age 59." --Wikipedia C.T. Brady also wrote book reviews for the New York Times.
